author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> If it's not using on chain DA, it's not an L2 :)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> But I can see where you're coming from. Not sure if it really achieves that much though, because the versioning byte is mainly there for the point evaluation precompile. If you are using a commitment that can't be used in the point evaluation precompile, then what is the use of it?

author: bridge-bot
content: <EdFelten> A different chain could extend the point evaluation precompile, to allow proofs of points against other versioned hash/commitment types. This could be backward compatible if the new types were in a reserved space.

author: bridge-bot
content: <EdFelten> I'd also argue that versioned hashes will probably have other uses in Ethereum in the future--and presumably also in L2/L3 systems--and it seems like a good idea to avoid conflicts in how these are defined.  This has value beyond the 4844 context.
